item.title: Two unnecessary metal poles on the public pathway, 9th November
item.description:
There are two big metal poles and other side of a tree on Stanhope Grove. It is just below the postbox, outside the houses in the late 90s. The tree is well grown and the poles are not serving any purpose. They are at child height on a road which children walk and scoot to school every day. If a child or frail adult fell, they could be badly injured. I am a public health nurse and these really are an accident waiting to happen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanhope Grove, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive leaf fall which is a slip hazard, 9th November
item.description:
This eyesore of a tree causes us distress every Autumn with its excessive leaf fall on the pavement immediately outside our property and onto our driveway. The photos I have added show what had come down since it was all cleared away (including the pavement) the previous day. We are filling our brown bin - which costs us £80 per year - with these leaves, and it is unacceptable. Coupled with the effort it takes to clear them away each day and the treacherous slip hazard they inevitably have this time of year, something needs to be done asap. An elderly relative walks with crutches and has nearly fallen before, where the crutches slipped on the damp, slimy leaves. They are now reluctant to visit until it is completely cleared of leaves. This area needs an immediate clean up please. And can we ask this tree be looked at. It is the biggest one in the road, and not only is it unsightly, we found when we had our driveway done some 3 years ago that the roots are travelling onto our property. We really hope they do not start lifting our stone work, like it has done the pavement, or reaches the foundations of our house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Inglewood Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
